sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that neither the Summary Compensation Table nor total direct compensation values adequately measure CEO compensation for the purpose of assessing pay-for-performance alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both methods utilize accounting conventions to estimate values of long-term incentive awards at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As might be expected, these estimated values can differ significantly from the actual value that is ultimately earned from these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this reason, the Committee also looks at realizable compensation which measures compensation based on a three-year average of salary, annual bonus, long-term incentive awards, dividend equivalents (if any) and other direct compensation elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable compensation plays an important role in helping the Committee assess the actual alignment of our compensation program with shareowners long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It captures the impact of UTCs current share price performance on previously granted long-term incentive awards by using the in-the-money value for these awards rather than the gran date fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The in-the-money value is defined as the difference between the closing price of our Common Stock at the end of the fiscal year and the exercise price of the award (if any) multiplied by the number of shares underlying SAR and PSU awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using this end-of-year stock price, realizable compensation directly correlates the value of an executives long-term incentive awards with the returns our shareowners receive from investing in our Common Stock over the same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, unlike the Summary Compensation Table, realizable compensation excludes any change in the value of an executives pension benefits during the year.

sentences.text: Plan Description.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The UTC Employee Retirement Plan is a tax-qualified plan subject to Internal Revenue Code provisions that, as of December 31, 2016 limit recognized annual compensation to $265,000 and annual retirement benefits to $210,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PPP is an unfunded, non-qualified retirement plan utilizing the same benefit formula, retirement eligibility and vesting provisions as the tax-qualified UTC Employee Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PPP provides benefits not accrued under the qualified plan due to the Internal Revenue Code limitations on annual compensation and retirement benefit amounts referenced above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to Pension Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the end of 2014, both of these pension plans used a traditional final average earnings (FAE) retiremen benefit formula for salaried employees hired prior to July 1, 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this formula, the plans provided an annual benefit equal to 2% of the executives earnings (defined on the following page) for each year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION TABLES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of service up to a maximum of twenty years, plus 1% of earnings for each year of service thereafter, minus 1.5% of the executives Social Security benefits for each year of service (up to a maximum of 50% of the annual Social Security benefit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings recognized under this formula consisted of the highest average annual base salary and annual bonus received over any consecutive five calendar-year period ending on or before December 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FAE formula did not recognize long-term incentive compensation earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 31, 2014, the FAE formula was replaced prospectively by a cash balance formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash balance formula credits a participants account with amounts that grow each month with two types of creditspay credits and interest credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay credits range from 3% to 8% of base salary and annual bonus, depending on the participants age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest credits are based on 30-year U.S. Treasury Bond yields and are subject to annual adjustments, but cannot fall below 3.8%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired on or after July 1, 2002, but prior to January 1, 2010, including Mr. McDonough, participate under this same cash balance formula for all of their years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lump-sum and annuity distribution options are available for amounts credited under these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because amounts payable under the PPP are unfunded and unsecured, either a lump-sum or two- to ten-year annual installment distribution options (equivalent to the lump-sum) are available as an alternative to a monthly annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A PPP lump-sum distribution is immediately and fully taxable as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PPP lump-sum calculation of the FAE portion of the benefit uses a discount rate equal to the Barclays Capital Municipal Bond Index averaged over five years (currently 2.354%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This non-taxable investment index is intended to yield an after-tax income stream on the net after-tax proceeds reinvested in tax free bonds that are comparable to a more tax efficient annuity distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lump-sum value of the cash balance portion of the benefit will be equal to the accumulated cash balance account described above.

sentences.text: As more fully discussed in the CD&A, the fundamental objective of UTCs compensation program is to closely align our executives compensation opportunities with the long-term interests of our shareowners.

sentences.text: For senior leadership, the substantial majority of compensation is both stock-based and contingent on performance.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design and operation of an executive compensation program for a large, complex, global enterprise such as UTC involves multiple objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that UTCs executive compensation programs have been effective in attracting and retaining senior business leaders with the requisite talen and skills to drive UTCs financial, strategic and operational performance.

sentences.text: As described on page 34 of this Proxy Statement, UTCs executive compensation programs are designed to support the following guiding principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibility: Compensation should take into account each executives responsibility to act in accordance with our ethical, environmental, health and safety objectives at all times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial, strategic and operational performance must not compromise these values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A complete commitment to ethical and corporate responsibility is a fundamental principle incorporated into all aspects of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay-for-performance: A substantial portion of compensation should be variable, contingent on and directly linked to individual, Company and business unit performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term focus: For our most senior executives, long-term, stock-based compensation opportunities should significantly outweigh short-term, cash- based opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual objectives should complement sustainable long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitiveness: Total compensation should be sufficiently competitive to attract, retain and motivate a leadership team capable of maximizing UTCs performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element should be benchmarked relative to peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balance: The portion of total compensation contingent on performance should increase with an executives level of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual and long-term incentive compensation opportunities should reward the appropriate balance of short- and long-term financial, strategic and operational business results.

sentences.text: United Technologies Corporation (the Company) reports its financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We supplement the reporting of our financial information determined under GAAP with certain non-GAAP financial information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-GAAP information presented provides investors with additional useful information, but should not be considered in isolation or as substitutes for the related GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, other companies may define non-GAAP measures differently, which limits the usefulness of these measures for comparisons with those companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage investors to review our financial statements and publicly-filed reports in their entirety and not to rely on any single financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted net sales, organic sales, adjusted net income and adjusted diluted EPS are non-GAAP financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted net sales represents consolidated net sales from continuing operations (a GAAP measure), excluding significant items of a non-recurring and non-operational nature (hereinafter referred to as other significant items).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Organic sales represents consolidated net sales (a GAAP measure), excluding the impact of foreign currency translation, acquisitions and divestitures completed in the preceding twelve months and other significant items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted net income represents net income from continuing operations (a GAAP measure), excluding restructuring costs and other significant items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted diluted EPS represents diluted earnings per share from continuing operations (a GAAP measure), excluding restructuring costs and other significant items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management believes that the non- GAAP measures just mentioned are useful in providing period-to-period comparisons of the results of the Companys ongoing operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free cash flow is a non-GAAP financial measure that represents cash flow from operations (a GAAP measure) less capital expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management believes free cash flow is a useful measure of liquidity and an additional basis for assessing UTCs ability to fund its activities, including the financing of acquisitions, debt service, repurchases of UTCs common stock and distribution of earnings to shareholders.
